required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate the Effects of Ocrelizumab on Immune Responses In Participants With Relapsing Forms of Multiple Sclerosis
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase IIIB, Multicenter, Randomized, Parallel-Group, Open-Label Study to Evaluate the Effects of Ocrelizumab on Immune Responses in Patients With Relapsing Forms of Multiple Sclerosis

brief_summary.textblock: This multicenter, randomized, open-label study will evaluate the immune response to vaccines (tetanus toxoid [TT]-containing adsorbed vaccine, 23-valent pneumococcal polysaccharide vaccine [23-PPV] either unboosted or boosted with 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine [13-PCV], influenza vaccine, keyhole limpet hemocyanin [KLH]) after administration of a dose of ocrelizumab (OCR) in participants with relapsing multiple sclerosis (RMS).

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Positive Response to TT Vaccine Measured 8 Weeks After TT Vaccine
primary_outcome.time_frame: 8 weeks after TT vaccine (see Intervention Description for detailed timing of administration)
primary_outcome.description: Positive response is defined as a tetanus antibody titer greater than or equal to (>/=) 0.2 international units per milliliter (IU/mL) or a 4-fold increase in antibody titers compared with prevaccination levels.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Positive Response to TT Vaccine Measured 4 Weeks After TT Vaccine
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 weeks after TT vaccine (see Intervention Description for detailed timing of administration)
secondary_outcome.description: Positive response is defined as a tetanus antibody titer >/=0.2 IU/mL or a 4-fold increase in antibody titers compared with prevaccination levels.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Tetanus Antibody Titer >/=0.2 IU/mL or 2-Fold Increase in Tetanus Antibody Titers
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 weeks after TT vaccine (see Intervention Description for detailed timing of administration)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Levels of Anti-Tetanus Antibody
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately prior to and 4 weeks after TT vaccine (see Intervention Description for detailed timing of administration)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Positive Response Against Individual Anti-Pneumococcal Antibody Serotype to 23-PPV
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 weeks after 23-PPV (see Intervention Description for detailed timing of administration)
secondary_outcome.description: Positive response is defined as a 2-fold increase in anti-pneumococcal antibody level or greater than (>) 1 microgram per milliliter (mcg/mL) rise compared with preimmunization levels.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Positive Response Against >/=2 Pneumococcal Antibody Serotypes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 weeks after 23-PPV (see Intervention Description for detailed timing of administration)
secondary_outcome.description: Positive response is defined as a 2-fold increase in anti-pneumococcal antibody level or >1 mcg/mL rise compared with preimmunization levels.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Positive Response Against >/=11 Pneumococcal Antibody Serotypes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 weeks after 23-PPV (see Intervention Description for detailed timing of administration)
secondary_outcome.description: Positive response is defined as a 2-fold increase in anti-pneumococcal antibody level or >1 mcg/mL rise compared with preimmunization levels.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Levels of Anti-Pneumococcal Antibody
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately prior to and 4 weeks after 23-PPV (see Intervention Description for detailed timing of administration)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Levels of Anti-KLH Antibody: Immunoglobulin (Ig) G
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately prior to first KLH administration and 4 weeks after last KLH administration (see Intervention Description for detailed timing of administration)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Levels of Anti-KLH Antibody: IgG + IgM
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4, 8, and 12 weeks after first KLH administration (see Intervention Description for detailed timing of administration)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Positive Response Against Individual Anti-Pneumococcal Antibody Serotype to 13-PCV
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 weeks after 13-PCV (see Intervention Description for detailed timing of administration)
secondary_outcome.description: Positive response is defined as a 2-fold increase in anti-pneumococcal antibody level or >1 mcg/mL rise compared with preimmunization levels.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Level of Anti-Pneumococcal Antibody
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately prior to and 4 weeks after 13-PCV (see Intervention Description for detailed timing of administration)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Seroprotection
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 weeks after influenza immunization (see Intervention Description for detailed timing of administration)
secondary_outcome.description: Seroprotection is defined as specific hemagglutination inhibition (HI) titers >1:40.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with 2-Fold Increase in Specific HI Titers
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 weeks after influenza immunization (see Intervention Description for detailed timing of administration)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with 4-Fold Increase in Specific HI Titers
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 weeks after influenza immunization (see Intervention Description for detailed timing of administration)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Seroconversion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 weeks after influenza immunization (see Intervention Description for detailed timing of administration)
secondary_outcome.description: Seroconversion is defined as prevaccination antibody titer <10 and postvaccination HI titer >40.

secondary_outcome.measure: Strain-Specific Geometric Mean Titer Levels
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Week 4

secondary_outcome.measure: Ratio of Strain-Specific Geometric Mean Titer Levels Postvaccination to Prevaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately prior to and 4 weeks after influenza vaccine (see Intervention Description for detailed timing of administration)

secondary_outcome.measure: MRI Parameters of Disease Activity and Progression
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and every 1 year until withdrawal from treatment (up to ~7 years overall)

secondary_outcome.measure: Cellular Immune Response Assessed by Flow Cytometry
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Days 1, 15, 84, 85, 98, 112, 140, 169, 238, and 252; thereafter at 22- and 24-week intervals until at least 48 weeks from last OCR administration (up to ~7 years overall)
secondary_outcome.description: Flow cytometry will include total B cells and B-cell subsets, total T cells, T helper cells, cytotoxic lymphocyte T cells, and natural killer cells.

secondary_outcome.measure: Humoral Immune Response Assessed by Ig Levels
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Days 1, 84, 85, 98, 169, 238, and 252; thereafter at 22- and 24-week intervals until at least 48 weeks from last OCR administration (up to ~7 years overall)
secondary_outcome.description: Quantitative Ig assessments will include total Ig, IgG and IgG subtypes, IgM, and IgA.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Anti-Drug Antibody Formation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Days 1, 84, 98, 140, 169, 238, and 252; thereafter at 22- and 24-week intervals until at least 48 weeks from last OCR administration (up to ~7 years overall)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline until at least 48 weeks from last OCR administration (up to ~7 years overall)

arm_group.description: Participants will receive dual infusion of OCR 300 milligrams (mg) on Day 1 and then on Day 15, and then participants will further receive immunization course (TT-containing adsorbed vaccine, 23-PPV either unboosted or boosted with 13-PCV, influenza vaccine, and repeated administration with KLH) at 12 weeks post-OCR treatment until Week 24. Participants who complete the 24-week immunization study period will have the option for retreatment with a single infusion of 600 mg OCR on Day 169 and subsequent single infusions (600 mg OCR) at intervals of 24 weeks. Participants who have received one or more infusions of OCR will enter the 48-week safety follow-up period.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Group B: Vaccines (Optional OCR in Extension)
arm_group.description: Participants will receive immunizations (TT-containing adsorbed vaccine, 23-PPV, influenza vaccine, and repeated administration with KLH) on Day 1 until Week 12 of the immunization period. Participants who complete the 12-week immunization study period will have the option to receive two single infusions of OCR 300 mg, on Day 84 and Day 98, and subsequent single infusions (600 mg OCR) at intervals of 24 weeks. Participants who have received one or more infusions of OCR will enter the 48-week safety follow-up period.

intervention.description: The 23-PPV vaccine will be given as a 0.5-milliliter (mL) intramuscular (IM) injection in the deltoid muscle on Day 112 (Group A) or Day 28 (Group B).
intervention.arm_group_label: Group B: Vaccines (Optional OCR in Extension)

intervention.description: The 13-PCV booster will be given as an IM injection in the deltoid muscle on Day 140 (select participants in Group A).
The influenza vaccine will be given as an IM injection in the deltoid muscle at any time between Day 85 and Day 144 (select participants in Group A) or any time between Day 1 and Day 85 (Group B).
intervention.arm_group_label: Group B: Vaccines (Optional OCR in Extension)

intervention.description: KLH will be given as a 1-mg subcutaneous (SC) injection on Days 84, 112, and 140 (Group A) or Days 1, 28, and 56 (Group B).
intervention.arm_group_label: Group B: Vaccines (Optional OCR in Extension)

intervention.description: OCR will be given as an intravenous (IV) infusion at a dose of 300 or 600 mg according to the specifications described in the corresponding Group A and Group B arms.
intervention.arm_group_label: Group B: Vaccines (Optional OCR in Extension)

intervention.description: The TT-containing adsorbed vaccine will be given as a 0.5-mL IM injection in the deltoid muscle on Day 85 (Group A) or Day 1 (Group B).
intervention.arm_group_label: Group B: Vaccines (Optional OCR in Extension)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of RMS in accordance with the revised McDonald criteria
- Received at least one previous immunization against TT or tetanus and diphtheria (DT/Td) or tetanus, diphtheria, and acellular pertussis (DTaP/Tdap)
- Expanded Disability Status Scale (EDSS) at Screening from 0 to 5.5 points, inclusive
- For sexually active participants with reproductive potential, use of reliable means of contraception
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contraindications for or intolerance to oral or IV corticosteroids, including IV methylprednisolone, according to the country label
- Known presence of other neurologic disorders
- Treatment with any investigational agent within 24 weeks of screening or 5 half-lives of the investigational drug, whichever is longer, or treatment with any experimental procedure for multiple sclerosis

facility.name: University of Miami School of Medicine; Dept. of Neurology Movement Disorder Center
Mercy Hospital St. Louis / Mercy Clinic Neurology
Cleveland Clinic Lou Ruvo; Center for Brain Research
